WikiLeaks Founder Julian Assange Facing Extradition After Losing Challenge
entry.summary: Julian Assange, the founder of WikiLeaks, is facing extradition from Britain to the United States after losing a challenge that would prevent that. Assange, who is wanted on 18 charges related to the release of confidential U.S. military records and diplomatic cables, will, however, renew his appeal next week according to a report by Reuters. The British High Court ruled that Assange had no legal grounds to challenge the extradition decision. Previously, a British judge ruled against Assange's extradition, citing concerns about his mental health and the risk of suicide if held in a maximum security prison. However, the decision was overturned on appeal after the U.S. authorities provided assurances, including the possibility of transferring Assange to Australia to serve any sentence. WikiLâ€¦

entry.title: Two Russians Charged for Infiltrating Mt Gox and Operating Illicit Crypto Exchange, BTC-e
entry.summary:
In a statement issued on Friday, the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) revealed that two Russian individuals have been accused of infiltrating a cryptocurrency exchange and running an unlawful exchange. Reportedly, the pair gained unauthorized access to Mt Goxâ€™s servers from 2011 to 2014 and purportedly pilfered 647,000 bitcoins from the now-dissolved exchange.
Russian Duo Accused of Orchestrating Mt Gox Heist and Operating Underground Crypto Exchange
The U.S. government has charged two Russians for breaching Mt Gox and managing the former crypto exchange BTC-e. The defendants, Alexey Bilyuchenko and Aleksandr Verner, are believed by authorities to have collaborated with Alexander Vinnik in running BTC-e.
As stated in the indictment, â€œAs alleged in the indictments, starting in 2011, Bâ€¦

entry.title: Crypto.com Shuts Down US Institutional Exchange Amid Regulatory Concerns
entry.summary:
Crypto.com, the Singapore-based exchange, has announced that it will shut down its institutional exchange service for US customers due to limited demand. The closure will take effect on June 21, 2023, and comes amid regulatory concerns in the US market, likely referencing the recent legal actions against Binance and Coinbase.
Crypto.com Offers Advanced Notice To Institutional Users
In a statement provided to Blockworks, the company explained that the lack of demand from US institutions led to the decision to suspend the institutional offering of the Crypto.com Exchange. The impacted institutional users were given advance notice to support a smooth transition.
It is important to note that this closure does not affect the exchangeâ€™s retail trading app, which includes its Commodity Fuâ€¦

entry.title: EUâ€™s Crypto Law MiCA Receives Publication In Official Journal
entry.summary:
The European Unionâ€™s Markets in Crypto Assets law (MiCA) has been published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU), marking the beginning of the implementation of comprehensive cryptocurrency licensing regulations.
This law requires crypto wallet providers to verify the identity of their customers during fund transfers. It also establishes a licensing framework for cryptocurrency companies to operate across the European Union.
Additionally, MiCA introduces new governance and financial requirements for issuers of stablecoins, which are cryptocurrencies pegged to a stable asset like a fiat currency. The publication of the extensive over 200-page law signifies its official inclusion in the European Unionâ€™s statute book.
The law is scheduled to come into force after a 20-daâ€¦

entry.title: Bitcoin Active Addresses Spike, What Does This Mean?
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows that Bitcoin active addresses have registered a spike recently. Hereâ€™s what this may mean for the market.
Bitcoin Active Addresses Spike Following Uptick In Volatility
According to data from the on-chain analytics firm Santiment, utility on the network has picked up quite drastically recently. The â€œactive addressesâ€ here refer to the Bitcoin addresses that are taking part in some kind of transaction activity on the blockchain. These addresses can be both senders and receivers.
The â€œdaily active addresses,â€ an on-chain indicator, measures the total number of unique such addresses that are appearing on the network every day. By â€œunique,â€ whatâ€™s meant here is that the metric only counts every active address just once, implying that even if a wallet makes multiple traâ€¦

entry.title: Breaking: DOJ Takes Down Mt. Gox Hackers For Multi-Million Dollar Crypto Theft
entry.summary:
The United States Department of Justice (DOJ) has announced the unsealing of charges related to the 2011 hack of the crypto exchange Mt. Gox and the operation of the illicit cryptocurrency exchange BTC-e.Â
The charges were brought against two Russian nationals, Alexey Bilyuchenko and Aleksandr Verner who are accused of conspiring to launder approximately 647,000 Bitcoin (BTC) from their hack of Mt. Gox. According to court documents, Bilyuchenko is also charged with conspiring with Alexander Vinnik to operate BTC-e from 2011 to 2017.
DOJ Busts Bitcoin Bandits In Major Crypto Hack
The indictment alleges that Bilyuchenko and Verner stole a massive amount of cryptocurrency from Mt. Gox, leading to the exchangeâ€™s ultimate insolvency. Bilyuchenko allegedly used the ill-gotten gains to heâ€¦

entry.title: Biggest Movers:Â SOL Slightly Higher, as XRP Collides With Key Resistance Level
entry.summary:
Solana moved towards the $20.00 mark on Friday, despite reports confirming that Robinhood was set to delist the token from its platform. In addition to solana, cardano and polygon were also removed. XRP also trended higher in todayâ€™s session.
Solana (SOL)
Solana (SOL) moved close to the $20.00 level on Friday, despite news that Robinhood was removing the token from its platform.
According to reports, the removal will occur on June 27. This comes after the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) determined that several tokens on Coinbase and Binance were securities.
Following a low of $18.56 on Thursday, SOL/USD moved to an intraday high of $19.30 during todayâ€™s session.
Todayâ€™s surge came as the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) neared a resistance level of 43.00
At the time of writing, the index is tracking at 41.14, with SOL at the $19.08 level.
Despite earlier gains easing after the reports, SOL remains above yesterdayâ€™s low.
XRP
XRP, formerly ripple, managed to avoid Robinhoodâ€™s hit list, surging by over 3% on Friday as a result.
XRP/USD jumped to a peak at $0.5324 earlier in todayâ€™s session, which comes less than 24 hours after the price bottomed out at $0.5184.
Fridayâ€™s surge in price led to the token briefly breaking out of a key resistance level of $0.5320.
This comes as the RSI collided with a ceiling of its own at 64.00, with bears so far rejecting a breakout.
Currently, the index is tracking marginally lower at 63.50, with longer-term bulls targeting a higher ceiling at 70.00.
Should they reach this point, there is a good chance that XRP will trade close to $0.5800, which was last hit in March.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Will Robinhood continue to delist more tokens? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

Still, events like the collapse of Terra and FTX in 20222 have certainly damaged investors' trust in crypto.

entry.summary: Justin Sun, Tron founder and advisor to crypto exchange Huobi, talks to Decrypt's Liam Kelly and Stacy Elliott about the impact of Hong Kong allowing residents to trade crypto, complications of restricting access based on location, and how AI will change the industry.

entry.title: NVIDIA's AI Push Could Change Gaming Forever
entry.summary: Computer tech firm NVIDIA profited off the crypto mining industry. Now, it's looking to artificial intelligenceâ€”and its stock price is soaring.

entry.title: Why InfiniGods Laughs at 'AAA' Web3 Games
entry.summary: The InfiniGods founders share their approach to game development and offer a critique of games that call themselves "AAA."

entry.title: Make it Fast, Make it Friendly: Jerome de Tychey Unpacks Key Themes at This Year's EthCC
entry.summary: After six years running, EthCC is back, this time in Paris from July 17 to July 20. Decrypt sat down with the brains behind one of Ethereumâ€™s longest-running events Jerome de Tychey to get an inside look into whatâ€™s on the agenda this year, several unannounced guests, and the rollout of at least one â€œsecretâ€ DeFi project.

entry.title: Unioverse Game Preview: Hands-on With the Cinematic Proving Grounds
entry.summary: The Unioverse is a multimedia sci-fi franchise with plans to facilitate user-generated content. Decrypt reporter and GG producer Kate Irwin checked out the Unioverse as Reyu, an alien character, and navigated the Proving Grounds with him. In the Proving Grounds, you'll fight an array of different drone-like flying robots (some have tentacles!!) as you navigate the puzzle-like dystopian environment. Alien meets Portal, anyone?
